description: Number of alternating sign n X n matrices invariant under a half-turn.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
R. P. Stanley, A baker's dozen of conjectures concerning plane partitions, pp. 285-293 of "Combinatoire Enumerative (Montreal 1985)", Lect. Notes Math. 1234, 1986.
links: G. Kuperberg, Symmetry classes of alternating-sign matrices under one roof, arXiv math.CO/0008184
D. P. Robbins, Symmetry classes of alternating sign matrices, arXiv:math.CO/0008045
mathematica: a[n_?OddQ] := a[n] = (a[n-1]*Binomial[(3*(n-1))/2, (n-1)/2])/ Binomial[n-1, (n-1)/2]; a[n_?EvenQ] := a[n] = (4*a[n-1]*Binomial[(3*n)/2, n/2])/ (3*Binomial[n, n/2]); a[1] = 1; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 11}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Sep 12 2012, from Robbins's conjectured(!) formula *)
prog: (PARI) /* from Robbins's conjectured(!) formula *//* using memoization for efficiency */N=33;  v=vector(N); v[1]=1;{ for (n=2, N,    if (bitand(n,1),        v[n] = (v[n-1]*binomial((3*(n-1))/2, (n-1)/2)) / binomial(n-1, (n-1)/2);    ,        v[n] = (4*v[n-1]*binomial((3*n)/2, n/2))/ (3*binomial(n, n/2));    );); }v /* show terms *//* _Joerg Arndt_, Sep 12 2012 */
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
